channel.title: Can i run a Nvidia GT430 GDDR3 alongside my GTX260?
channel.description:
See above?
Im looking to boost up my video memory as the GTX260 has only got 800.
Would like a cheap but better then GTX260 as my primary and have the GTX as my secondry.
Also looking to get another 4gb Corsair DDR2 ram :D

item.title: Can i run a Nvidia GT430 GDDR3 alongside my GTX260?
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

Okay cheers. I might just get 1 430 and then get another at a later date.

Read full topic
item.source: Can i run a Nvidia GT430 GDDR3 alongside my GTX260?

item.title: Can i run a Nvidia GT430 GDDR3 alongside my GTX260?
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

No, they need to be the same GPU unless you want to dedicate one just for Physx - which wouldn’t gain you much in most games. I know you can do two cards from the same series with ATI GPUs, but I’m not sure about NVIDIA - but even so, it is best not to put two GPUs together that aren’t pretty much identical.

The way crossfire and SLI work is by rendering either half the frame each or alternate frames (there may be more techniques they use, im not sure), so having one card faster than the other would create some pretty funky results while playing your games, so they slow down the fastest GPU to the speed of the slowest.

Read full topic
item.source: Can i run a Nvidia GT430 GDDR3 alongside my GTX260?
